p: Lavandula angustifolia (lavender ) is a native aromatic shrub in the Mediterranean region that belongs to the Lamiaceae family ( 74, 75). Different extract forms of this plant including essential oil, aqueous extract, alcoholic extract, hydroalcoholic extract, and phenolic extract have been used in traditional treatment. While the main constituents of the essential oil of lavender are linalool and linalyl acetate, aqueous extract of lavender primarily consists of caffeic acid and luteolin ( Figure 1) ( 76, 77). Our study indicated that the aqueous extract of lavender has no toxic effect on the Hep G2 cell line ( 75).
